meanings.definition: The state or quality of being windy or breezy.
meanings.sent1: The blowinesses outside made the trees sway gently.
meanings.sent2: I love the fresh blowinesses of a spring morning.
meanings.sent3: The blowinesses messed up my hair, but it felt refreshing.
meanings.sent4: Her dress billowed in the blowinesses like a sail on a ship.
meanings.sent5: The blowinesses carried the scent of flowers through the air.

meanings.definition: The act of blowing or being blown.
meanings.sent1: The sudden blowinesses of the wind startled the children.
meanings.sent2: The blowinesses of the fan kept the room cool.
meanings.sent3: He exaggerated the blowinesses of his trumpet playing for fun.
meanings.sent4: The blowinesses of the storm were fierce and unrelenting.
meanings.sent5: The blowinesses of the wind carried the kite high into the sky.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being inflated or puffed up.
meanings.sent1: The blowinesses of the balloon made it float effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The blowinesses of his ego were evident in his arrogant behavior.
meanings.sent3: She joked about the blowinesses of the marshmallow she roasted.
meanings.sent4: The blowinesses of the clouds made them look like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The blowinesses of the bubble gum made it pop loudly when she blew a bubble.
